ygData.subject: Re: an Idea
ygData.msgSnippet: There s a known bug with illusions where if you zone in after someone has cast an illusion, that person will appear to be their normal height no matter what
ygData.messageBody:
There's a known bug with illusions where if you zone in after someone has
cast an illusion, that person will appear to be their normal height no
matter what their illusion is. Typically you see this in dungeons where an
ogre (troll/barbarian) uses a guise of the deceiver to make himself into a
dark elf that's ogre height.

----- Original Message -----
From: Andy Smith <AndyS@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, January 17, 2000 12:48 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ_Tinkering] an Idea


> From: Andy Smith <AndyS@...>
>
> Illusions do wear off, but if you hang around the palace you'll notice
that
> King Ak'Anon casts a lot of spells. As for the size difference, I am
> mystified. Whenever my gnome casts illusion:human, he's normal sized.
>
> You bring up an interesting point, I don't know that anybody has ever
killed
> the king.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Quasinom de Plume [mailto:eqmailing@...]
> Sent: Monday, January 17, 2000 3:41 PM
> To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] an Idea
>
>
> From: =?iso-8859-1?q?Quasinom=20de=20Plume?= <eqmailing@...>
>
> I assumed the same thing but I was confused as to how he shrunk himself
> considering that is a shaman-only spell. If a gnome enchanter was to
> illusion him/herself as a human, he/she would be full size.
>
> One question I have to you enchanter folks - does the illusion ever run
> off? If so - then wouldn't the King periodically have to recast the
> illusion?
>
> Hehe perhaps if someone killed him, he would drop a item that would have
> "shrinked illusion" as an effect. I for one am not about to attempt it
> however. I like having a "kindly" faction to my own king. :)
>
> QdP
>
> "Quasinom de Plume is my quasi nom-de-plume"
>
> --- Gazamel Prime <gazamel@...> wrote:
> > Yay, I was hoping someone else figured this out
> > besides me. The king is an enchanter, and he's
> > typically in human form. I'm fairly certain that if
> > you cancel magic on him (not an aggressive spell) that
> > you'd see his true form. Being a warrior, I can't
> > really cast this spell, so I've yet to see this =)
> >
> > Gazamel
> >
> > --- Yigman008@... wrote:
> > > the king isn't a clockwork, the clockwork next to it
> > > is, if ou say hail next
> > > to one of those spider ones, no matter which one it
> > > is, it says unit not
> > > authorized for speaking or somethin.
> > >
